revised_title: Computation of the Ratio of the Diameter of a Circle to Its Circumference to 208 Places of Figures: A Mathematical Approach
tldr: The author, William Rutherford, computed the ratio of a circle's diameter to its circumference to 208 decimal places using a series of mathematical formulas and tables. He employed a simplified process of division and combined three series to achieve this level of accuracy. The result was a more precise approximation than previous methods, which had only reached up to 152 decimal places.
